info.description:
Netlify is a hosting service for the programmable web. It understands your documents and provides an API to handle atomic deploys of websites, manage form submissions, inject JavaScript snippets, and much more. This is a REST-style API that uses JSON for serialization and OAuth 2 for authentication.

This document is an OpenAPI reference for the Netlify API that you can explore. For more detailed instructions for common uses, please visit the [online documentation](https://www.netlify.com/docs/api/). Visit our Community forum to join the conversation about [understanding and using Netlifyâ€™s API](https://community.netlify.com/t/common-issue-understanding-and-using-netlifys-api/160).

Additionally, we have two API clients for your convenience:
- [Go Client](https://github.com/netlify/open-api#go-client)
- [JS Client](https://github.com/netlify/js-client)
info.title: Netlify's API documentation

get.description: Returns all environment variables for an account or site. An account corresponds to a team in the Netlify UI. To use this endpoint, your site must no longer be using the classic environment variables experience. Migrate now with the Netlify UI.

parameters.description: If specified, only return environment variables set on this site
parameters.name: site_id

post.description: Creates new environment variables. Granular scopes are available on Pro plans and above. To use this endpoint, your site must no longer be using the classic environment variables experience. Migrate now with the Netlify UI.

parameters.description: If provided, create an environment variable on the site level, not the account level
parameters.name: site_id

key.description: The existing or new name of the key, if you wish to rename it (case-sensitive)

scopes.description: The scopes that this environment variable is set to (Pro plans and above)

delete.description: Deletes an environment variable. To use this endpoint, your site must no longer be using the classic environment variables experience. Migrate now with the Netlify UI.

parameters.description: If provided, delete the environment variable from this site
parameters.name: site_id

get.description: Returns an individual environment variable. To use this endpoint, your site must no longer be using the classic environment variables experience. Migrate now with the Netlify UI.

parameters.description: If provided, return the environment variable for a specific site (no merging is performed)
parameters.name: site_id

patch.description: Updates or creates a new value for an existing environment variable. To use this endpoint, your site must no longer be using the classic environment variables experience. Migrate now with the Netlify UI.

parameters.description: The existing environment variable key name (case-sensitive)
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: If provided, update an environment variable set on this site
parameters.name: site_id

context.description: The deploy context in which this value will be used. `dev` refers to local development when running `netlify dev`.

put.description: Updates an existing environment variable and all of its values. Existing values will be replaced by values provided. To use this endpoint, your site must no longer be using the classic environment variables experience. Migrate now with the Netlify UI.

parameters.description: The existing environment variable key name (case-sensitive)
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: If provided, update an environment variable set on this site
parameters.name: site_id

key.description: The existing or new name of the key, if you wish to rename it (case-sensitive)

scopes.description: The scopes that this environment variable is set to (Pro plans and above)

delete.description: Deletes a specific environment variable value. To use this endpoint, your site must no longer be using the classic environment variables experience. Migrate now with the Netlify UI.

parameters.description: If provided, delete the value from an environment variable on this site
parameters.name: site_id

200.description: get all DNS zones the user has access to
get all DNS records for a single DNS zone

parameters.description: the account of the dns zone
parameters.name: account_id

parameters.description: the account you want to transfer the dns zone to
parameters.name: transfer_account_id

parameters.description: the user you want to transfer the dns zone to
parameters.name: transfer_user_id

200.description: transfer a DNS zone to another account

get.description: **Note:** Environment variable keys and values will soon be moved from `build_settings.env` and `repo.env` to a new endpoint. Please use [getEnvVars](#tag/environmentVariables/operation/getEnvVars) to retrieve site environment variables.

post.description: **Note:** Environment variable keys and values will soon be moved from `build_settings.env` and `repo.env` to a new endpoint. Please use [createEnvVars](#tag/environmentVariables/operation/createEnvVars) to create environment variables for a site.

get.description: **Note:** Environment variable keys and values will soon be moved from `build_settings.env` and `repo.env` to a new endpoint. Please use [getEnvVars](#tag/environmentVariables/operation/getEnvVars) to retrieve site environment variables.

patch.description: **Note:** Environment variable keys and values will soon be moved from `build_settings.env` and `repo.env` to a new endpoint. Please use [updateEnvVar](#tag/environmentVariables/operation/updateEnvVar) to update a site's environment variables.

put.description:
[Beta] Unlinks the repo from the site.

This action will also:
- Delete associated deploy keys
- Delete outgoing webhooks for the repo
- Delete the site's build hooks

get.description: **Note:** Environment variable keys and values will soon be moved from `build_settings.env` and `repo.env` to a new endpoint. Please use [getEnvVars](#tag/environmentVariables/operation/getEnvVars) to retrieve site environment variables.

post.description: **Note:** Environment variable keys and values will soon be moved from `build_settings.env` and `repo.env` to a new endpoint. Please use [createEnvVars](#tag/environmentVariables/operation/createEnvVars) to create environment variables for a site.

key.description: The environment variable key, like ALGOLIA_ID (case-sensitive)

scopes.description: The scopes that this environment variable is set to

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the value was last updated

values.description: An array of Value objects containing values and metadata

avatar_url.description: A URL pointing to the user's avatar

full_name.description: The user's full name (first and last)

context.description: The deploy context in which this value will be used. `dev` refers to local development when running `netlify dev`.

id.description: The environment variable value's universally unique ID
